parameter.name: ResultNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Result.{i}.
object.description: Neighboring SSID table. This table models other WiFi SSIDs that this device is able to receive.

parameter.name: Radio
parameter.description: The Radio that detected the neighboring WiFi SSID.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The current service set identifier in use by the neighboring WiFi SSID. The value MAY be empty for hidden SSIDs.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The BSSID used for the neighboring WiFi SSID.

parameter.name: Mode
parameter.description: The mode the neighboring WiFi radio is operating in.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The current radio channel used by the neighboring WiFi radio.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description: An indicator of radio signal strength (RSSI) of the neighboring WiFi radio measured in {{units}}, as an average of the last 100 packets received.

parameter.name: SecurityModeEnabled
parameter.description:
The type of encryption the neighboring WiFi SSID advertises.
The {{enum|WEP}} value indicates either WEP-64 or WEP-128.
The {{enum|WPA}} value is the same as WPA-Personal.
The {{enum|WPA2}} value is the same as WPA2-Personal.
The {{enum|WPA-WPA2}} value is the same as WPA-WPA2-Personal.
The {{enum|WPA3-SAE}} value is the same as WPA3-Personal.
The {{enum|WPA2-PSK-WPA3-SAE}} value is the same as WPA3-Personal-Transition.

parameter.name: EncryptionMode
parameter.description:
The type of encryption the neighboring WiFi SSID advertises.
When {{param|SecurityModeEnabled}} is one of {{enum|WPA3-SAE|SecurityModeEnabled}}, {{enum|WPA2-PSK-WPA3-SAE|SecurityModeEnabled}}, or {{enum|WPA3-Enterprise|SecurityModeEnabled}}, {{enum|TKIP}} is not valid, and should not be in the list.

parameter.name: OperatingFrequencyBand
parameter.description: Indicates the frequency band at which the radio this SSID instance is operating.

parameter.name: SupportedStandards
parameter.description:
{{list}} List items indicate which IEEE 802.11 standards this {{object}} instance can support simultaneously, in the frequency band specified by {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}}. {{enum}}
Each value indicates support for the indicated standard.
If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|2.4GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|b}}, {{enum|g}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ax}} are allowed.
If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|5GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|a}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ac}}, {{enum|ax}} are allowed.

parameter.name: OperatingStandards
parameter.description:
{{list}} List items indicate which IEEE 802.11 standard that is detected for this {{object}}.
Each value indicates support for the indicated standard.
If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|2.4GHz|##.Radio.{i}.SupportedFrequencyBands}}, only values {{enum|b}}, {{enum|g}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ax}} are allowed.
If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|5GHz|##.Radio.{i}.SupportedFrequencyBands}}, only values {{enum|a}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ac}}, {{enum|ax}} are allowed.
For example, a value of "g,b" (or "b,g" - order is not important) means that the 802.11g standard {{bibref|802.11g-2003}} is used with a backwards-compatible mode for 802.11b {{bibref|802.11b-1999}}. A value of "g" means that only the 802.11g standard can be used.

parameter.name: OperatingChannelBandwidth
parameter.description: Indicates the bandwidth at which the channel is operating.

parameter.name: BeaconPeriod
parameter.description: Time interval (in {{units}}) between transmitting beacons.

parameter.name: Noise
parameter.description: Indicator of average noise strength (in {{units}}) received from the neighboring WiFi radio.

parameter.name: BasicDataTransferRates
parameter.description: {{list}} Basic data transmit rates (in Mbps) for the SSID. For example, if {{param}} is "1,2", this indicates that the SSID is operating with basic rates of 1 Mbps and 2 Mbps.

parameter.name: SupportedDataTransferRates
parameter.description: {{list}} Data transmit rates (in Mbps) for unicast frames at which the SSID will permit a station to connect. For example, if {{param}} is "1,2,5.5", this indicates that the SSID will only permit connections at 1 Mbps, 2 Mbps and 5.5 Mbps.

parameter.name: DTIMPeriod
parameter.description: The number of beacon intervals that elapse between transmission of Beacon frames containing a TIM element whose DTIM count field is 0. This value is transmitted in the DTIM Period field of beacon frames. {{bibref|802.11-2020}}

object.name: OpClass.{i}.
object.description: The Operating Classes for which this channel scan is requested.

parameter.name: OperatingClass
parameter.description: The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} of the OpClass and Channel tuple scanned by the Radio. Note that the Operating Class identifies the band and channel width. For 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands, only 20MHz Operating Classes are valid.

object.name: OpClass.{i}.Channel.{i}.
object.description: The Channels for which this channel scan is requested.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The Channel number of the Channel that is requested to be scanned.

parameter.name: DwellTime
parameter.description: The duration of the time to scan each channel in {{units}}. A value of 50 {{units}} is suggested.

parameter.name: DFSDwellTime
parameter.description: The duration of time to scan each Dynamic Frequency Selection (DFS) channel in {{units}}. A value of at least one beacon interval, typically 100 {{units}}, is suggested.

parameter.name: HomeTime
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} after which the driver has to go back to the original channel before scanning the next channel to avoid disruption. If this is omitted, or is not supported by the device, then it should be ignored.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The Service Set Identifier (SSID) to scan. If omitted, then all SSIDs are scanned.

parameter.name: TargetBSS
parameter.description: Basic Service Set Identifier (BSSID) of the target BSS which the associated device(s) is to be associated to.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The number of the Wi-Fi channel the backhaul BSS is to be associated to. If {{param}} is not specified, then the radio is to determine which channel to use to associate to the requested SSID.

parameter.name: TimeOut
parameter.description: The maximum timeout for this backhaul steering to occur in {{units}}.

parameter.name: DisassociationImminent
parameter.description: Indicates if the disassociation is imminent, as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.6.13.9}}.

parameter.name: DisassociationTimer
parameter.description: The number of {{units}} until the AP sends a disassociation frame to this station. If {{param}}=0 then {{param}} is not used.

parameter.name: BSSTerminationDuration
parameter.description: The number of {{units}} for which the BSS is not present. If {{param}}=0 or if this input in not provided, then {{param}} is not used.

parameter.name: ValidityInterval
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that the {{command}} is valid for. If {{param}}=0 or if this input in not provided, then {{param}} is not used.

parameter.name: SteeringTimer
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that this associated device is not allowed to return to the original BSS. If {{param}}=0 or if this input in not provided, then {{param}} is not used.

parameter.name: TargetBSS
parameter.description: BSSID of the target BSS which the associated device(s) is to be associated to.

parameter.name: TargetBSS
parameter.description: The BSSID of the remote BSS.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: The duration after which the request is timed out in {{units}}.

parameter.name: OperatingClass
parameter.description: The Operating Class in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} for which the measurement is requested.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The number of the channel for which the measurement is requested.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description: The received signal strength (RSSI) as received by the radio measured in {{units}}. RSSI is encoded as per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-176}}. Reserved: 221 - 255.

parameter.name: Noise
parameter.description: An indicator of the average radio noise plus interference power as received by the radio. Encoded as defined for ANPI in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 11.10.9.4}}.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The number of the Wi-Fi channel the clear channel assessment (CCA) measurement is run on.

parameter.name: DwellTime
parameter.description: The duration of the CCA measurement in {{units}}.

parameter.name: CCAReport
parameter.description:
The clear channel assessment (CCA) report in the format specified in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.21.3}}.
When read, the value of this parameter MUST correspond to {{param|Channel}}. How this is achieved is a local matter to the CPE.

parameter.name: DisassociationTimer
parameter.description: The time for which the associated device is to be disassociated in {{units}}. If set to 0, then the associated device is blocked indefinately.

parameter.name: ReasonCode
parameter.description: The reason code for the request for the associated device to be disassociated, as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-49}}.

parameter.name: Silent
parameter.description:
An optional input, if true then this is a request for a Silent Disassociate, whereby the AP is to remove the station from its list of associated devices without sending a message to the station.
If this input in not provided, then a value of {{false}} is assumed.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} For 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands, only 20MHz Operating Classes are valid.
Note that the operating class identifies the band and channel width.

parameter.name: ChannelList
parameter.description: {{list}} The channel numbers in this Operating Class for which the capability is being described.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} For 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands, only 20MHz Operating Classes are valid.
Note that the operating class identifies the band and channel width.

parameter.name: ChannelList
parameter.description: The channel numbers in this Operating Class for which the capability is being described.

parameter.name: HE160
parameter.description: Indicates support for High Efficiency (HE) 160 MHz.

parameter.name: HE8080
parameter.description: Indicates support for HE 80+80 MHz.

parameter.name: MCSNSS
parameter.description: Supported High Efficiency-Modulation and Coding Scheme (HE-MCS) and Number of Spatial Streams (NSS) Set field as defined in {{bibref|802.11ax|Figure 9-788d}} Supported HE-MCS And NSS Set field format. HE-MCS And NSS Set field for 160MHz is present if 160MHz is supported. HE-MCS And NSS Set field for 80+80MHz is present if 80+80MHz is supported.

parameter.name: SUBeamformer
parameter.description: Indicates support for Single-User (SU) Beamformer.

parameter.name: SUBeamformee
parameter.description: Indicates support for SU Beamformee.

parameter.name: MUBeamformer
parameter.description: Indicates support for Multi-User (MU) Beamformer.

parameter.name: Beamformee80orLess
parameter.description: Indicates support for Beamformee Space-Time Stream (STS) ≤ 80 MHz.

parameter.name: BeamformeeAbove80
parameter.description: Indicates support for Beamformee STS > 80 MHz.

parameter.name: ULMUMIMO
parameter.description: Indicates support for Uplink (UL) Multi-User Multiple Input, Multiple Output (MU-MIMO).

parameter.name: ULOFDMA
parameter.description: Indicates support for UL Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing (OFDMA).

parameter.name: MaxDLMUMIMO
parameter.description: Max number of users supported per DL MU-MIMO Transmitter (TX) in an AP role.

parameter.name: MaxULMUMIMO
parameter.description: Max number of users supported per UL MU-MIMO Receiver (RX) in an AP role.

parameter.name: MaxDLOFDMA
parameter.description: Max number of users supported per Downlink (DL) OFDMA TX in an AP role.

parameter.name: MaxULOFDMA
parameter.description: Max number of users supported per UL OFDMA RX in an AP role.

parameter.name: RTS
parameter.description: Indicates support for Request To Send (RTS).

parameter.name: MURTS
parameter.description: Indicates support for MU RTS.

parameter.name: MultiBSSID
parameter.description: Indicates support for Multi-Basic Service Set Identifier (BSSID).

parameter.name: MUEDCA
parameter.description: Indicates support for MU Enhanced distributed channel access (EDCA).

parameter.name: TWTRequestor
parameter.description: Indicates support for Target Wake Time (TWT) Requestor.

parameter.name: TWTResponder
parameter.description: Indicates support for TWT Responder.

parameter.name: SpatialReuse
parameter.description: Indicates support for EasyMesh configuration and reporting of BSS Color and Spatial Reuse.

parameter.name: AnticipatedChannelUsage
parameter.description: Indicates support for Anticipated Channel Usage (ACU) reporting.

parameter.name: OUI
parameter.description: Any Organizationally Unique Identifier (OUI) value specified in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}}).

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Any suite type value specified in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}}.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The SSID.

parameter.name: VID
parameter.description: The VLAN ID (VID).

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: Service prioritization rule Identifier.

parameter.name: Precedence
parameter.description: Rule Precedence – higher number means higher priority.

parameter.name: Output
parameter.description: Rule Output. The value of, or method used to select, the 802.1Q C-TAG Priority Code Point (PCP) output value.

parameter.name: AlwaysMatch
parameter.description: Indicates if the rule always matches.

parameter.name: BSSColor
parameter.description: The value of the BSS Color subfield of the HEOperations.BSSColorInformation field being transmitted by BSSs operating on this radio. (EasyMesh TLV Field: BSS Color)

parameter.name: HESIGASpatialReuseValue15Allowed
SRGInformationValid
NonSRGOffsetValid
PSRDisallowed
NonSRGOBSSPDMaxOffset
parameter.description:
The value of dot11NonSRGAPOBSSPDMaxOffset (i.e the Non-SRG OBSSPD Max Offset value being used to control the transmissions of the specified radio). (EasyMesh TLV Field: Non-SRG OBSSPD Max Offset)
This field is valid only if {{param|NonSRGOffsetValid}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: SRGOBSSPDMinOffset
parameter.description:
The value of dot11SRGAPOBSSPDMinOffset (i.e. the SRG OBSSPD Min Offset value being used to control the transmissions of the specified radio). (EasyMesh TLV Field: SRG OBSSPD Min Offset)
This field is valid only if {{param|SRGInformationValid}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: SRGOBSSPDMaxOffset
parameter.description:
The value of dot11SRGAPOBSSPDMaxOffset (i.e. the SRG OBSSPD Max Offset value being used to control the transmissions of the specified radio). (EasyMesh TLV Field: SRG OBSSPD Max Offset)
This field is valid only if {{param|SRGInformationValid}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: SRGBSSColorBitmap
parameter.description:
The value of dot11SRGAPBSSColorBitmap (i.e. the SRG BSS Color Bitmap being used to control the tranmissions of the specified radio). (EasyMesh TLV Field: SRG BSS Color Bitmap)
This field is valid only if {{param|SRGInformationValid}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: SRGPartialBSSIDBitmap
parameter.description:
The value of dot11SRGAPBSSIDBitmap (i.e. the SRG Partial BSSID Color Bitmap being used to control the transmissions of the specified radio). (EasyMesh TLV Field: SRG Partial BSSID Bitmap)
This field is valid only if {{param|SRGInformationValid}} is {{true}}.
Note: See rules in section 26.10.2.3 of [17] regarding the members of an SRG.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.
object.description: This object represents the Wi-Fi Alliance Data Elements as defined in {{bibref|DataElements}} with extended capabilities in additional objects whose names begin with MultiAP.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.
object.description: This object describes a Wi-Fi network containing 1 or more Access Point (AP) devices.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: A unique identifier for this particular Wi-Fi network.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this group was collected. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

parameter.name: ControllerID
parameter.description: A unique identifier for a Multi-AP controller.

parameter.name: DeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MSCSDisallowedStaList
parameter.description: List of STAs for which Mirrored Stream Classification Service (MSCS) operation is disallowed.

parameter.name: SCSDisallowedStaList
parameter.description: List of STAs for which Stream Classification Service (SCS) operation is disallowed.

parameter.name: SSIDNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.SSID.{i}.
object.description: This object specifies SSIDs for fronthaul use across all agents in this Wi-Fi Multi-AP network, or on this single-AP. Also specifies the {{param|Band}} for each {{param|SSID}}.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The SSID for fronthaul use across this Wi-Fi Multi-AP network.

parameter.name: Band
parameter.description: The band(s) (GHz) for which this {{param|SSID}} applies. {{enum}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.MultiAPSteeringSummaryStats.
object.description:
The summary of statistics related to Multi-AP Steering for the Wi-Fi network.
The counters contained in {{object}} are all reset on reboot.

parameter.name: NoCandidateAPFailures
parameter.description: Number of times Associated Devices should have been steered but weren't because a better candidate AP couldn't be found.

parameter.name: BlacklistAttempts
parameter.description: Number of times a Blacklist steer was attempted.

parameter.name: BlacklistSuccesses
parameter.description: Number of times an attempted Blacklist steer succeeded.

parameter.name: BlacklistFailures
parameter.description: Number of times an attempted Blacklist steer failed.

parameter.name: BTMAttempts
parameter.description: Number of times a BTM (BSS Transition Management; {{bibref|802.11k}}) steer was attempted.

parameter.name: BTMSuccesses
parameter.description: Number of times an attempted BTM (BSS Transition Management; {{bibref|802.11k}}) steer succeeded.

parameter.name: BTMFailures
parameter.description: Number of times an attempted BTM (BSS Transition Management; {{bibref|802.11k}}) steer failed.

parameter.name: BTMQueryResponses
parameter.description: Number of asynchronous BTM (BSS Transition Management; {{bibref|802.11k}}) Queries for which a BTM Request was issued.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.
object.description: Each instance of this object represents an individual Access Point device in the Wi-Fi network.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: A unique identifier for this particular device within the Wi-Fi network as defined in {{bibref|DataElements|Section 3.1}}.

parameter.name: MultiAPCapabilities
parameter.description: The Multi-AP capabilities supported by this device as defined by the APCapability TLV in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.6}}.

parameter.name: CollectionInterval
parameter.description: The interval between the collection of consecutive measurements of the most frequently updated Data Element from this device in {{units}}.

parameter.name: ReportUnsuccessfulAssociations
parameter.description: Indicates whether the Multi-AP Agent or the single AP reports unsuccessful association attempts of client Stations (STAs) to the Multi-AP Controller.

parameter.name: MaxReportingRate
parameter.description: Maximum rate for reporting unsuccessful association attempts in {{units}}.

parameter.name: APMetricsReportingInterval
Manufacturer
parameter.description: Identifier of the manufacturer of the device.

parameter.name: SerialNumber
parameter.description:
Identifier of the particular Access Point device that is unique for the indicated model and manufacturer.
This value MUST remain fixed over the lifetime of the device, including across firmware updates.

parameter.name: ManufacturerModel
parameter.description: Identifier of the manufacturer model to help the user more easily identify a particular piece of equipment.

parameter.name: SoftwareVersion
parameter.description: Identifier of the software version currently installed in the Access Point device (i.e. version of the overall firmware).

parameter.name: ExecutionEnv
parameter.description: Identifier of the execution environment (operating system) in the device. This parameter can be an entry in the table {{object|Device.SoftwareModules.ExecEnv.{i}.}}.

parameter.name: DSCPMap
parameter.description: A hexadecimal string of 64 Priority Code Point (PCP) values (one octet per value) corresponding to the Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) markings 0x00 to 0x3F, ordered by increasing DSCP value. Each octet is in the range 0x00 – 0x07. This is used to select a PCP value if a Service Prioritization Rule specifies Rule Output: 0x08

parameter.name: MaxPrioritizationRules
parameter.description: The maximum total number of service prioritization rules supported by the Agent.

parameter.name: PrioritizationSupport
parameter.description: Indicates support for Service Prioritization.

parameter.name: MaxVIDs
parameter.description: Max Total Number of unique VLAN IDs (VIDs) the Multi-AP Agent supports.

parameter.name: APMetricsWiFi6
parameter.description:
Associated Wi-Fi6 STA Status Inclusion Policy.
: {{true}}: Include Associated Wi-Fi6 STA Status TLV in AP Metrics Response.
: {{false}}: Do not include Associated Wi-Fi6 STA Status TLV [3] in AP Metrics Response.

parameter.name: CountryCode
parameter.description: Two-character country code in which the Multi-AP Agent is operating according to {{bibref|ISO3166-1}}. The characters are encoded as UTF-8.

parameter.name: LocalSteeringDisallowedSTAList
parameter.description: {{list}} The STAs for which local steering is disallowed.

parameter.name: BTMSteeringDisallowedSTAList
parameter.description: {{list}} The STAs for which BSS Transition Management (BTM) steering is disallowed.

parameter.name: DFSEnable
parameter.description: Indicates if Dynamic Frequency Selection (DFS) is enabled or disabled.

parameter.name: ReportIndependentScans
parameter.description:
Channel Scan Reporting Policy, Report Independent Channel Scans
: {{true}}: report Independent Channel Scans,
: {{false}}: do not report Independent Channel Scans unless explicitly requested in a Channel Scan Request.

parameter.name: AssociatedSTAinAPMetricsWiFi6
MaxUnsuccessfulAssociationReportingRate
parameter.description: For EasyMesh {{bibref|EasyMesh}}, this is the maximum rate for reporting unsuccessful association attempts (in attempts per {{units}}).

parameter.name: STASteeringState
CoordinatedCACAllowed
TrafficSeparationAllowed
parameter.description: This parameter indicates if EasyMesh traffic separation {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 19.1}} is allowed or disallowed.

parameter.name: ServicePrioritizationAllowed
parameter.description: This parameter indicates if EasyMesh service prioritization {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 20}} is allowed or disallowed.

parameter.name: RadioNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: Default8021QNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: SSIDtoVIDMappingNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: CACStatusNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: IEEE1905SecurityNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: SPRuleNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: AnticipatedChannelsNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: AnticipatedChannelUsageNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Default8021Q.{i}.
object.description: The default 802.1Q settings for EasyMesh service prioritization {{bibref|EasyMesh}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables default 802.1Q settings.

parameter.name: PrimaryVID
parameter.description: The primary 802.1Q C-TAG (VLAN ID).

parameter.name: DefaultPCP
parameter.description: The default Priority Code Point (PCP).

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.SSIDtoVIDMapping.{i}.
object.description: The Service Set Identifier (SSID) to VLAN ID mapping for EasyMesh traffic separation {{bibref|EasyMesh}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.CACStatus.{i}.
object.description: Latest Channel Availability Check (CAC) Status Report from the device.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this group was collected.

parameter.name: CACAvailableChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: CACNonOccupancyChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: CACActiveChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.CACStatus.{i}.CACAvailableChannel.{i}.
object.description: This object describes available channels identified by Channel Availability Check (CAC).

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description: Operating class of an available channel, from {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: Single channel number of an available channel in the given operating class.

parameter.name: Minutes
parameter.description: {{units}} since CAC was completed identifying available channel. Equals zero for non-DFS channels.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.CACStatus.{i}.CACNonOccupancyChannel.{i}.
object.description: This object describes channels identified by Channel Availability Check (CAC) that may not be occupied.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description: Operating class of a channel that is in the non-occupancy list, from {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: Single channel number in the operating class on which the radar was detected.

parameter.name: Seconds
parameter.description: {{units}} remaining in the non-occupancy duration for the channel specified by the operating class and channel pair.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.CACStatus.{i}.CACActiveChannel.{i}.
object.description: This object describes channels with ongoing Channel Availability Check (CAC).

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description: Operating class of a channel that has ongoing CAC, from {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: Single channel number in the operating class that has an ongoing CAC.

parameter.name: Countdown
parameter.description: {{units}} remaining to complete the CAC.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.SPRule.{i}.
object.description: This object describes a list of service prioritization (SP) rules {{bibref|EasyMesh}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.IEEE1905Security.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the IEEE 1905 security capabilities.

parameter.name: OnboardingProtocol
parameter.description:
Onboarding protocols supported;
:0: 1905 Device.

parameter.name: IntegrityAlgorithm
parameter.description:
Message integrity algorithms supported.
: 0: HMAC-SHA256.

parameter.name: EncryptionAlgorithm
parameter.description:
Message encryption algorithms supported.
: 0: AES-SIV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.AnticipatedChannels.{i}.
object.description:
This object contains a table of Wi-Fi 6 {{bibref|802.11ax}} operating classes, and channels within those operating classes, which have anticipated channel preference.
Operating Class contains an enumerated value from {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}}.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}.
Note that the operating class identifies the band and channel width. This changed from readOnly to readWrite in version 2.15.

parameter.name: ChannelList
parameter.description: {{list}} The channel numbers in this Operating Class.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.AnticipatedChannelUsage.{i}.
object.description: This object reports Wi-Fi 6 {{bibref|802.11ax}} anticipated medium usage on channels (and subsets of those channels) on which the device is operating.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description: The operating class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The channel number in the given operating class of the channel on which the anticipated channel usage is reported.

parameter.name: ReferenceBSSID
parameter.description: Reference BSSID. Start Time values in this object are referenced to the Time Sync Function (TSF) timer value indicated in the Timestamp field in Beacon frames transmitted by this BSSID on the channel.

parameter.name: EntryNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.AnticipatedChannelUsage.{i}.Entry.{i}.
object.description: This object reports an entry for anticipated channel usage {{bibref|802.11ax}}.

parameter.name: BurstStartTime
parameter.description:
Least significant 4 octets of the TSF timer of the Reference BSSID, at the start of the anticipated first burst of channel usage.
Note: a burst is a continuous or quasi-continuous period of channel usage. For IEEE 802.11 transmissions, a burst might comprise only one PPDU, or multiple closely spaced PPDUs.

parameter.name: BurstLength
parameter.description: Duration of each burst of channel usage in {{units}}.

parameter.name: Repetitions
BurstInterval
parameter.description: Interval between two successive bursts of channel usage in {{units}}; set to zero if {{param|Repetitions}} is zero.

parameter.name: RUBitmask
parameter.description: Bitmask of 26-tone Resource Units (RUs) defined in {{bibref|802.11ax|Section 27.3.2.2}}, where the (i-1)th bit position is set to one if the nominal bandwidth of the channel usage corresponding to this entry fully or partially overlaps with the RUi, and is otherwise set to zero.

parameter.name: TransmitterIdentifier
PowerLevel
parameter.description: Indicates maximum transmit power during each channel usage burst in {{units}}; equal to 255 when unknown or when the entry corresponds to multiple transmitters with different transmit powers

parameter.name: ChannelUsageReason
parameter.description: The reason for this anticipated channel usage. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: TSPEC or other traffic stream with predictable characteristics.
Scheduler policy (if uplink, using Wi-Fi 6 trigger-based scheduling).
IEEE 802.11 transmitter external to the BSSs operated by the reporting Agent.
BSS non-usage (in this special case, a burst is defined as a continuous period in which the Agent ensures no transmissions by any of its BSSs on the channel).

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.MultiAPDevice.
object.description: This object represents an individual Access Point device.

parameter.name: ManufacturerOUI
LastContactTime
parameter.description: The last time that the Access Point device was contacted via the Multi-AP control protocol.

parameter.name: AssocIEEE1905DeviceRef
parameter.description: {{param}} is a reference to the IEEE 1905.1 Network Topology Device. Since IEEE 1905.1 is a common protocol used by Multi-AP Controllers for communications, this parameter allows the MultiAP portion of the data model to reference the associated IEEE 1905.1 portion of the data model.

parameter.name: EasyMeshControllerOperationMode
parameter.description: This parameter represents the status of Wi-Fi CERTIFIED EasyMeshTM controller functionality. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Wi-Fi EasyMesh controller is not supported.
Wi-Fi EasyMesh controller is supported but not enabled.

parameter.name: EasyMeshAgentOperationMode
parameter.description: This parameter represents the status of Wi-Fi CERTIFIED EasyMeshTM agent functionality. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Wi-Fi EasyMesh agent is not supported.
Wi-Fi EasyMesh agent is supported but not enabled.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.MultiAPDevice.Backhaul.
object.description:
This object represents an individual Access Point device's Backhaul and unique aspects in the Wi-Fi network.
The endpoints of the backhaul interface are represented by the (Device's ID and interface MAC Address). This object represents the upward view of the backhaul interface. The two endpoints of the backhaul interface are - ({{param|BackhaulDeviceID}}, {{param|BackhaulMACAddress}}) of the uplinked Backhaul Device - {{param|MACAddress}} of this Access Point Device
{{param|BackhaulDeviceID}} / {{param|BackhaulMACAddress}} <-- {{param|LinkType}} --- < {{param|MACAddress}}
{{empty}} is reserved for the {{object}} instance that represents the Multi-AP Controller.

parameter.name: LinkType
parameter.description: The medium being used to backhaul this Access Point Device to the Backhaul Access Point Device. The {{enum|None}} value is reserved for the {{object}} instance that represents the Multi-AP Controller. {{enum}}

parameter.name: BackhaulMACAddress
parameter.description:
The MAC Address at the far end of the backhaul link of the interface on the network that is providing a backhaul for this Access Point Device. This along with {{param|BackhaulDeviceID}}, helps to identfy the backhaul interface endpoint.
{{empty}} is reserved for the {{object}} instance that represents the Multi-AP Controller.

parameter.name: BackhaulDeviceID
parameter.description: The Device's ID of the Device on the network that is providing a Backhaul Link for this Access Point Device.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC Address at the near end of the backhaul link of this Access Point Device's backhaul interface that is connecting via {{param|LinkType}} to {{param|BackhaulMACAddress}} of the Backhaul Device identified by {{param|BackhaulDeviceID}}.

parameter.name: CurrentOperatingClassProfileNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.MultiAPDevice.Backhaul.CurrentOperatingClassProfile.{i}.
object.description:
Describes one of the current Operating Classes in use by this Radio. One Opeating Class is indicated for each current Operating Channel Bandwidth.
The Channel indicated for the 20 MHz Operating Class is equal to the current primary channel.

parameter.name: Class
parameter.description: The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} that this radio is currently operating on.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: This Channel number in the Operating Class that this Radio is currently operating on.

parameter.name: TxPower
parameter.description:
Nominal Transmit Power EIRP that this radio is currently using for the current Channel in the Opeating Class.
Represented as 2's complement signed integer in units of decibels relative to 1 mW ({{units}}).

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this group was collected.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.MultiAPDevice.Backhaul.Stats.
object.description: This object represents the statistics of the backhaul interface view from the current Device's ID

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted across the backhaul medium (as identified by the value of the {{param|#.LinkType}} parameter), including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received across the backhaul medium (as identified by the value of the {{param|#.LinkType}} parameter), including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted across the backhaul medium (as identified by the value of the {{param|#.LinkType}} parameter), including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received across the backhaul medium (as identified by the value of the {{param|#.LinkType}} parameter), including framing characters.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: LinkUtilization
parameter.description: Current utilization (expressed in {{units}}) of the medium (as identified by the value of the {{param|#.LinkType}} parameter) being used to backhaul this Access Point device to the Multi-AP Controller. A value of 0 is used for the {{object}} instance that represents the Access Point on the Multi-AP Controller.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description: An indicator of radio signal strength of the backhaul link of the Access Point (AP) to the Multi-AP Controller, measured in {{units}}. RCPI threshold is encoded per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-176}}. The value of this parameter is indeterminate if the value of the {{param|#.LinkType}} parameter is anything other than {{enum|Wi-Fi|#.LinkType}}.

parameter.name: LastDataDownlinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission of data from the access point to the associated device.

parameter.name: LastDataUplinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission of data from the associated device to the access point.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this group was collected.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.
object.description: This object represents all of the individual Radios contained within the identified Access Point device known to the controller.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: A unique identifier for this particular Radio within the identified Access Point as defined in {{bibref|DataElements|Section 3.1}}.

parameter.name: Enabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether this radio is enabled or disabled.

parameter.name: Noise
parameter.description:
An indicator of the average radio noise plus interference power measured for the primary operating channel.
Encoded as defined for ANPI in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 11.10.9.4}}.

parameter.name: Utilization
parameter.description:
(Total Channel Utililzation) The percentage of time (linearly scaled with 255 representing 100%) that the Access Point device sensed the medium was busy, as indicated by either the physical or virtual carier sense (CS) mechanism. This is essentially the amount of time spent transmiting (both successful and failed transmissions), receiving (both local and non-local transmissions), and processing noise {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.27}}.
When more than one channel is in use for the BSS operating on the radio, the {{param}} value is calculated only for the primary channel.

parameter.name: Transmit
parameter.description:
(Transmit Channel Utilization) The percentage of time (linearly scaled with 255 representing 100%) that the radio has spent on sending individually or group addressed transmissions (successful and failed).
When more than one channel is in use for the BSS operating on the radio, the {{param}} value is calculated only for the primary channel.

parameter.name: ReceiveSelf
parameter.description:
(Receive Local Channel Utilization) The percentage of time (linearly scaled with 255 representing 100%) that the radio has spent on receiving individually or group addressed local transmissions (i.e. transmissions from any STA associated with any BSS operating on this radio).
When more than one channel is in use for the BSS operating on the radio, the {{param}} value is calculated only for the primary channel.

parameter.name: ReceiveOther
parameter.description:
(Receive Non-Local Channel Utilization) The percentage of time (linearly scaled with 255 representing 100%) that the radio has spent on receiving individually or group addressed non-local transmissions (i.e. valid IEEE 802.11 PPDUs that are not associated with any BSS operatin gon this radio).
When more than one channel is in use for the BSS operating on the radio, the {{param}} value is calculated only for the primary channel.

parameter.name: TrafficSeparationCombinedFronthaul
parameter.description: Indicates traffic separation on combined fronthaul and Profile-1 backhaul support {{bibref|EasyMesh}}.

parameter.name: TrafficSeparationCombinedBackhaul
parameter.description: Indicates traffic separation on combined Profile-1 backhaul and Profile-2 backhaul support {{bibref|EasyMesh}}.

parameter.name: SteeringPolicy
ChannelUtilizationThreshold
parameter.description: Channel Utilization Threshold (defined per Basic Service Set (BSS) Load element {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.27}}.).

parameter.name: RCPISteeringThreshold
parameter.description: RCPI Steering Threshold (encoded per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-176}}).

parameter.name: STAReportingRCPIThreshold
parameter.description:
Station (STA) Metrics Reporting RCPI Threshold.
: 0: Do not report STA Metrics based on RCPI threshold.
: 1 – 220: RCPI threshold (encoded per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-176}}).

parameter.name: STAReportingRCPIHysteresisMarginOverride
ChannelUtilizationReportingThreshold
AssociatedSTATrafficStatsInclusionPolicy
AssociatedSTALinkMetricsInclusionPolicy
ChipsetVendor
parameter.description: A string identifying the Wi-Fi chip vendor of this radio in the device.

parameter.name: APMetricsWiFi6
parameter.description:
Associated Wi-Fi6 STA Status Inclusion Policy.
: {{true}}: include Associated Wi-Fi6 STA Status TLV in AP Metrics Response.
: {{false}}: do not include Associated Wi-Fi6 STA Status TLV [3] in AP Metrics Response.

parameter.description: The MAC address of the logical STA sharing the radio for Wi-Fi backhaul.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.ScanCapability.
object.description: This object describes the channel scan capabilities of a radio.

parameter.name: OnBootOnly
parameter.description: “On boot only” flag, Indicates whether the specified radio is capable only of “On boot” scans.

parameter.name: Impact
parameter.description:
Scan Impact of using this radio to perform a scan.
: 1: No impact,
: 2: Reduced number of spatial streams,
: 3: Time slicing impairment,
: 4: Radio unavailable for >= 2 seconds.

parameter.name: MinimumInterval
parameter.description: Minimum Scan Interval, the minimum interval in {{units}} between the start of two consecutive channel scans on this radio.

parameter.name: OpClassChannelsNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.ScanCapability.OpClassChannels.{i}.
object.description: Table of the operating classes (selected from {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}) and channel numbers in each operating class that the radio is capable of scanning.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.CACCapability.
object.description: This object describes the Channel Availability Check (CAC) capabilities of a radio.

parameter.name: CACMethodNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.CACCapability.CACMethod.{i}.
object.description: List of Channel Availability Check (CAC) method information for each type of CAC that the radio can perform. Each type is defined by a method and time to complete. For each type, the classes and channels allowed are enumerated.

parameter.name: Method
parameter.description:
CAC method supported;
: 0: Continuous CAC,
: 1: Continuous with dedicated radio,
: 2: Multi-Input Multi-Output (MIMO) dimension reduced,
: 3: Time sliced CAC.

parameter.name: NumberOfSeconds
parameter.description: Number of {{units}} required to complete this method of CAC.

parameter.name: OpClassChannelsNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.description: Table of the operating classes (selected from {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}) and channel numbers in each operating class supported for this method of CAC.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.
object.description: This object represents the capabilities of the radio which may be different from the current operational configuration.

parameter.name: HTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the HT capabilities of the radio as defined by the HTCapabilities TLV {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.8}}.

parameter.name: VHTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the VHT capabilities of the radio as defined by the VHTCapabilities TLV {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.9}}.

Describes the HE capabilities of the radio as defined by the HECapabilities TLV {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.10}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi6bSTARole.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.CapableOperatingClassProfile.{i}.
object.description: Describes one of the possible Operating Classes supported by this Radio.

parameter.name: Class
parameter.description: The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} that this radio is capable of operating on.

parameter.name: MaxTxPower
parameter.description:
Maximum Transmit Power EIRP that this radio is capable of transmitting in the current regulatory domain for the Operating Class.
Represented as 2's complement signed integer in units of decibels relative to 1 mW ({{units}}).

parameter.name: NonOperable
parameter.description:
{{list}} The channel numbers which are statically non-operable in the Operating Class (i.e. the Radio is never able to operate on these channels).
Other channels from this Operating Class which are not listed here are supported for the Radio.

parameter.name: NumberOfNonOperChan
parameter.description: The number of non-operable channels contained in {{param|NonOperable}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.CurrentOperatingClassProfile.{i}.
object.description:
Describes one of the current Operating Classes in use by this Radio. One Operating Class is indicated for each current Operating Channel Bandwidth.
The Channel indicated for the 20 MHz Operating Class is equal to the current primary channel.

parameter.name: Class
parameter.description: The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} that this radio is currently operating on.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: This Channel number in the Operating Class that this Radio is currently operating on.

parameter.name: TxPower
parameter.description:
Nominal Transmit Power EIRP that this radio is currently using for the current Channel in the Opeating Class.
Represented as 2's complement signed integer in units of decibels relative to 1 mW ({{units}}).

parameter.name: TransmitPowerLimit
parameter.description: This is the upper limit on nominal transmit Equivalent Isotropically Radiated Power (EIRP) that this radio is allowed to use for the current {param|Class}}. In units of decibels relative to 1 mW {{units}}.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this group was collected. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.DisAllowedOpClassChannels.{i}.
object.description: The operating classes, and list of channels for each operating class, which are not allowed to be used on this radio.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables disallowed operating classes and channels.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} For 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands, only 20MHz Operating Classes are valid.
Note that the operating class identifies the band and channel width.

parameter.name: ChannelList
parameter.description: {{list}} The channel numbers in this Operating Class for which the capability is being described.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.SpatialReuse.
object.description:
The spatial reuse configuration of this radio. Applies only to Wi-Fi 6 {{bibref|802.11ax}} and possibly later generations of radios.
Acronyms: Spatial Reuse Group (SRG), Overlapping Basic Service Set (OBSS), Preamble Detection (PD).

parameter.name: PartialBSSColor
parameter.description: The value of the Partial Basic Service Set (BSS) Color subfield of the HEOperations.BSSColorInformation field being transmitted by BSSs operating on this radio. (EasyMesh TLV Field: Partial BSS Color)

parameter.name: NeighborBSSColorInUseBitmap
parameter.description: Bitmap of BSS colors of Overlapping BSSs (OBSSs) that the High-Efficiency (HE) AP has identified by itself or via the autonomous BSS Color collision reports received from associated non-AP HE STAs.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.
object.description: A single logical BSS operating on this radio.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the logical BSS (BSSID).

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The SSID in use for this BSS.

parameter.name: Enabled
parameter.description: Whether the BSSID is currently enabled (beaconing frames are being sent) or disabled.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: Time in {{units}} since the last change to the {{param|Enabled}} value.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this group was collected. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

parameter.name: UnicastBytesSent
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total unicast bytes transmitted.

parameter.name: UnicastBytesReceived
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total unicast bytes received.

parameter.name: MulticastBytesSent
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total multicast bytes transmitted.

parameter.name: MulticastBytesReceived
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total multicast bytes received.

parameter.name: BroadcastBytesSent
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total broadcast bytes transmitted.

parameter.name: BroadcastBytesReceived
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total broadcast bytes received.

parameter.name: ByteCounterUnits
parameter.description:
Byte Counter Units.
: 1: kibibytes (KiB)
: 2: mebibytes (MiB).

parameter.name: Profile1bSTAsDisallowed
Profile2bSTAsDisallowed
AssociationAllowanceStatus
parameter.description:
The status of allowance of new client device associations on this BSS.
: 0: No more associations allowed,
: 1: Associations allowed.

parameter.name: EstServiceParametersBE
parameter.description: Estimated Service Parameters information field for AC=BE, defined per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-637}} and referenced in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.22}}.

parameter.name: EstServiceParametersBK
parameter.description: Estimated Service Parameters information field for AC=BK, defined per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-637}} and referenced in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.22}}.

parameter.name: EstServiceParametersVI
parameter.description: Estimated Service Parameters information field for AC=VI, defined per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-637}} and referenced in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.22}}.

parameter.name: EstServiceParametersVO
parameter.description: Estimated Service Parameters information field for AC=VO, defined per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-637}} and referenced in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.22}}.

parameter.name: BackhaulUse
parameter.description:
Indicates that this BSS is in use as a backhaul BSS;
: {{true}}: backhaul BSS in use,
: {{false}}: backhaul BSS not in use.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}} 0 is in use and 1 is not in use.

parameter.name: FronthaulUse
parameter.description:
Indicates that this BSS is in use as a fronthaul BSS;
: {{true}}: fronthaul BSS in use,
: {{false}}: fronthaul BSS not in use.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}} 0 is in use and 1 is not in use.

parameter.name: R1disallowed
parameter.description:
Multi-AP Profile-1 [3] (R1) disallowed status.
: {{true}}: disallowed,
: {{false}}: allowed.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}} 0 is allowed and 1 is disallowed.

parameter.name: R2disallowed
parameter.description:
Multi-AP Profile-2 [3] (R2) disallowed status.
: {{true}}: disallowed,
: {{false}}: allowed.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}} 0 is allowed and 1 is disallowed.

parameter.name: MultiBSSID
parameter.description:
Multiple BSSID Set;
: {{true}}: configured,
: {{false}}: not-configured.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}}, 1 is configured and 0 is not-configured.

parameter.name: TransmittedBSSID
parameter.description:
Transmitted BSSID;
: {{true}}: transmitted,
: {{false}}: non-transmitted.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}}, 1 is transmitted and 0 is non-transmitted.

parameter.name: FronthaulAKMsAllowed
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate Authentication and Key Management (AKM) suites/security modes allowed at this BSS for fronthaul. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: "psk" indicates one or more of the PSK and FT-PSK AKMs defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}} typically at least "00-0F-AC:2" for interoperability.
"dpp" indicates one or more of the DPP and FT-DPP AKMs defined in {{bibref|EasyConnect|Section 8.4}}, typically at least "50-6F-9A:2" for interoperability.
"sae" indicates one or more of the SAE and FT-SAE AKMs defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}} typically at least "00-0F-AC:8" for interoperability.
AKM suite selector, each AKM suite selector (OUI and type) is encoded as a 4-octet hex-encoded value without internal delimiters, e.g. 506F9A02 {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}}.

parameter.name: BackhaulAKMsAllowed
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate Authentication and Key Management (AKM) suites/security modes allowed at this BSS for backhaul. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: "psk" indicates one or more of the PSK and FT-PSK AKMs defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}} typically at least "00-0F-AC:2" for interoperability.
"dpp" indicates one or more of the DPP and FT-DPP AKMs defined in {{bibref|EasyConnect|Section 8.4}}, typically at least "50-6F-9A:2" for interoperability.
"sae" indicates one or more of the SAE and FT-SAE AKMs defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}} typically at least "00-0F-AC:8" for interoperability.
AKM suite selector, each AKM suite selector (OUI and type) is encoded as a 4-octet hex-encoded value without internal delimiters, e.g. 506F9A02 {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}}.

parameter.name: STANumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: QMDescriptorNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ClientMAC
parameter.description: MAC address of STA for which this descriptor applies.

parameter.name: DescriptorElement
parameter.description:
The descriptor element. One of:
: MSCS descriptor element (as described in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.243}}, or
: SCS descriptor element (as described in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.121}}, or
: QoS Management DSCP policy element (as described in {{bibref|RFC8325|Section 5.3}}).

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.MultiAPRadio.

parameter.description: {{list}} List items represent channels in the non-occupancy list due to radars detected by Dynamic Frequency Selection (DFS) Channel Availability Check (CAC).

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.MultiAPSteering.
object.description: A single logical Access Point operating on this radio.

parameter.name: BlacklistAttempts
parameter.description:
Number of times a Blacklist steer was attempted for this Access Point.
Blacklist steering is the process of forcing a connected STA to move to another Access Point by temporarily blocking its access to the current Access Point.

parameter.name: BTMAttempts
parameter.description: Number of times a BTM (BSS Transition Management; {{bibref|802.11k}}) steer was attempted for this Access Point.

parameter.name: BTMQueryResponses

parameter.name: HTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the HT capabilities of the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: VHTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the VHT capabilities of the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: HECapabilities
ClientCapabilities
parameter.description: The frame body of the most recently received (Re)Association Request frame from this client (STA), as defined in Table 9-34 and Table 9-36 of {{bibref|802.11-2020}} in the order of the underlying referenced standard.

parameter.name: LastDataDownlinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission of data from the access point to the associated device.

parameter.name: LastDataUplinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission of data from the associated device to the access point.

parameter.name: UtilizationReceive
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that the Radio has spent on the Channel receiving data from this Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: UtilizationTransmit
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that the Radio has spent on the Channel transmitting data to this Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: EstMACDataRateDownlink
parameter.description: Estimate of the MAC layer throughput in {{units}} achievable in the downlink direction if 100% of channel airtime and BSS operating bandwidth were available, as defined in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.1}}.

parameter.name: EstMACDataRateUplink
parameter.description: Estimate of the MAC layer throughput in {{units}} achievable in the uplink direction if 100% of channel airtime and BSS operating bandwidth were available, as defined in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.1}}.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description:
An indicator of radio signal strength of the uplink from the associated STA to the access point - measured in {{units}}. RCPI threshold (encoded per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-176}}}, and described in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.1}}). Reserved: 221 - 255.
NOTE: The underlying WFA specification is in the process of being reviewed for possible clarification. Please refer to that specification for more details.

parameter.name: LastConnectTime
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} since this Assocated Device (STA) was associated.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted to the Associated Device.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received from the Associated Device.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted to the Associated Device.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received from the Associated Device.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. These might be due to the number of retransmissions exceeding the retry limit, or from other causes.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: RetransCount
parameter.description: The total number of transmitted packets which were retransmissions. Two retransmissions of the same packet results in this counter incrementing by two.

parameter.name: MeasurementReport
parameter.description: {{list}} Measurement Report element(s) received from the Associated Device (STA) that constitute the latest Beacon report as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-230}}.

parameter.name: NumberOfMeasureReports
parameter.description: The number of measurement report elements contained in {{param|MeasurementReport}}.

parameter.name: IPV4Address
parameter.description: IPV4 Address assigned to the client.

parameter.name: IPV6Address
parameter.description: IPV6Address assigned to the client.

parameter.name: Hostname
parameter.description: Hostname assigned to the client.

parameter.name: CellularDataPreference
ReAssociationDelay

object.name: Device.WiFi.MultiAP.
object.description:
This object describes a Wi-Fi network containing 1 or more Access Point devices.
This object is related to a Wi-Fi network that contains multiple Access Points (Multi-AP) and utilizes software logic to optimize that Wi-Fi network (typically via steering STAs, also known as Associated Devices, to the best Access Point). This object exposes the view of the Wi-Fi netwtork from the perspective of the Multi-AP Controller. The Wi-Fi Alliance EasyMesh solution is one example of managing a Multi-AP network.
This object and all sub-objects have been moved to new objects.
{{deprecated|2.15|because it has moved to {{object|##.WiFi.DataElements.Network}} MultiAP objects}}

parameter.description:
The current radio channel used by the connection.
To request automatic channel selection, set {{param|Device.WiFi.Radio.{i}.AutoChannelEnable}} to {{true}}.
Whenever {{param|Device.WiFi.Radio.{i}.AutoChannelEnable}} is {{true}}, the value of the {{param}} parameter MUST be the channel selected by the automatic channel selection procedure.
For channels in "wide mode" (where a channel bandwidth strictly greater than 20 MHz is used), this parameter is used for Primary Channel only. The secondary or extension channel information is available through {{param|ExtensionChannel}}.
Note: Valid {{param}} values depend on the {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} value specified and the regulatory domain.

For example, for 802.11b and North America, would be "1-11".

object.name: Device.WiFi.
object.description: The WiFi object is based on the IEEE 802.11 specifications ({{bibref|802.11-2020}}). It defines interface objects ({{object|Radio}} and {{object|SSID}}), and application objects ({{object|AccessPoint}} and {{object|EndPoint}}).

parameter.name: RadioNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: SSIDNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: AccessPointNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: EndPointNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ResetCounter
parameter.description: This parameter counts the number of WiFi host or driver resets since the last device reset. This parameter is reset to zero after the device resets, and increments with each successive WiFi host or driver reset.

parameter.name: ResetCause
parameter.description: Reports the cause for the previous Wi-Fi driver reset.

enumeration.description: Indicates that the host processor intentionally performed the reset. This can be due to an external instruction.
Indicates that the reset was spontaneous. This can be due to an error condition.
Indicates that the reset was due to a loss of mains power on the device.

object.name: Device.WiFi.Radio.{i}.
object.description:
This object models an 802.11 wireless radio on a device (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}).
If the device can establish more than one connection simultaneously (e.g. a dual radio device), a separate {{object}} instance MUST be used for each physical radio of the device. See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Appendix III.1}} for additional information.
Note: A dual-band single-radio device (e.g. an 802.11a/b/g radio) can be configured to operate at 2.4 or 5 GHz frequency bands, but only a single frequency band is used to transmit/receive at a given time. Therefore, a single {{object}} instance is used even for a dual-band radio.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description:
Enables or disables the radio.
This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description:
The current operational state of the radio (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}}
When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface).
When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason.
This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the radio as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the radio entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description:
{{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.
Note: Since {{object}} is a layer 1 interface, it is expected that {{param}} will not be used.

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description:
Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}).
For example:
* For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces.
* For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface.
* For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces.
An interface might have some SSIDs pointing towards the Internet and other SSIDs pointing towards End Devices. This is indicated by the associated {{param|#.SSID.{i}.Upstream}} parameters. This interface's {{param}} parameter is set to {{true}} if any of the associated ''SSID.{i}.Upstream'' parameters are {{true}}, and is set to {{false}} otherwise.
This parameter was DEPRECATED in 2.12 (and then OBSOLETED in 2.14) because it couldn't describe all multi-SSID use cases. It has now been restored, and its multi-SSID behavior has been clarified.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum PHY bit rate supported by this interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: SupportedFrequencyBands
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate the frequency bands at which the radio can operate.

parameter.name: OperatingFrequencyBand
parameter.description:
Indicates the frequency band at which the radio is operating.
If the radio supports multiple bands, and {{param}} is changed, then all parameters whose value is not valid for the new frequency band (e.g. {{param|Channel}}) MUST be set to a valid value (according to some CPE vendor-specific behavior).

parameter.name: SupportedStandards
parameter.description:
{{list}} List items indicate which IEEE 802.11 standards this {{object}} instance can support simultaneously, in the frequency band specified by {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}}. {{enum}}
Each value indicates support for the indicated standard.
If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|2.4GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|b}}, {{enum|g}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ax}} are allowed.
If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|5GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|a}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ac}}, {{enum|ax}} are allowed.

parameter.name: OperatingStandards
parameter.description:
{{list}} List items indicate which IEEE 802.11 standard this {{object}} instance is configured for.
Each value indicates support for the indicated standard.
If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|2.4GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|b}}, {{enum|g}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ax}} are allowed.
If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|5GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|a}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ac}}, {{enum|ax}} are allowed.
For example, a value of "g,b" (or "b,g" - order is not important) means that the 802.11g standard {{bibref|802.11g-2003}} is used with a backwards-compatible mode for 802.11b {{bibref|802.11b-1999}}. A value of "g" means that only the 802.11g standard can be used.

parameter.name: PossibleChannels
parameter.description:
{{list}} List items represent possible radio channels for the wireless standard (a, b, g, n, ac, ax) and the regulatory domain.
Ranges in the form "n-m" are permitted.
For example, for 802.11b and North America, would be "1-11".

parameter.name: ChannelsInUse
parameter.description:
{{list}} List items represent channels that the radio determines to be currently in use (including any that it is using itself).
Ranges in the form "n-m" are permitted.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description:
The current radio channel used by the connection. To request automatic channel selection, set {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} to {{true}}.
Whenever {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} is {{true}}, the value of the {{param}} parameter MUST be the channel selected by the automatic channel selection procedure.
For channels in "wide mode" (802.11n where a 40MHz channel bandwidth is used), this parameter is used for Primary Channel only. The secondary or extension channel information is available through {{param|ExtensionChannel}}.
Note: Valid {{param}} values depend on the {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} value specified and the {{param|RegulatoryDomain}}.

parameter.name: AutoChannelSupported
parameter.description: Indicates whether automatic channel selection is supported by this radio. If {{false}}, then {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} MUST be {{false}}.

parameter.name: AutoChannelEnable
parameter.description:
Enable or disable automatic channel selection.
Set to {{false}} to disable the automatic channel selection procedure, in which case the currently selected channel remains selected.
Set to {{true}} to enable the automatic channel selection procedure. This procedure MUST automatically select the channel, and MAY also change it subsequently.
{{param}} MUST automatically change to {{false}} whenever the channel is manually selected, i.e. whenever the {{param|Channel}} parameter is written.
Whenever {{param}} is {{true}}, the value of the {{param|Channel}} parameter MUST be the channel selected by the automatic channel selection procedure.

parameter.name: AutoChannelRefreshPeriod
parameter.description:
The time period in {{units}} between two consecutive automatic channel selections. A value of 0 means that the automatic channel selection is done only at boot time.
This parameter is significant only if {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: ChannelLastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the current {{param|Channel}} came into use.

parameter.name: ChannelLastSelectionReason
parameter.description: The cause of the last channel selection.

enumeration.description: Automatic channel selection procedure launched at radio startup.
Automatic channel selection procedure triggered by the user (e.g. via a GUI).
Automatic channel selection procedure triggered by the {{param|AutoChannelRefreshPeriod}} timer.
Automatic channel selection procedure dynamically triggered to adjust to environmental interference.
Automatic channel selection procedure triggered by Dynamic Frequency Selection (DFS) {{bibref|ETSIBRAN}}.

parameter.name: MaxSupportedSSIDs
parameter.description: Maximum number of SSIDs supported on this radio.

parameter.name: MaxSupportedAssociations
parameter.description: Maximum number of associated devices supported.

parameter.name: FirmwareVersion
parameter.description: This radio's WiFi firmware version.

parameter.name: SupportedOperatingChannelBandwidths
parameter.description: {{list}} These are the valid writable values for {{param|OperatingChannelBandwidth}}.

parameter.name: OperatingChannelBandwidth
parameter.description: The preferred channel bandwidth to be used (applicable to 802.11n, 802.11ac, and 802.11ax specifications only).

parameter.name: CurrentOperatingChannelBandwidth
parameter.description: The channel bandwidth currently in use.

parameter.name: ExtensionChannel
parameter.description: The secondary extension channel position (applicable to the 802.11n specification only), applicable when operating in wide channel mode (i.e. when {{param|OperatingChannelBandwidth}} is set to {{enum|40MHz|OperatingChannelBandwidth}} or {{enum|Auto|OperatingChannelBandwidth}}).

parameter.name: GuardInterval
parameter.description: The guard interval value between OFDM symbols.

parameter.name: CenterFrequencySegement0
CenterFrequencySegement1
CenterFrequencySegment0
parameter.description: When operating in {{enum|80+80MHz|CurrentOperatingChannelBandwidth}}, this parameter determines the Center Frequency Segment 0 for the first 80 MHz channel. See {{bibref|802.11-2016|Section 9.4.2.161}} and Table 9-252.

parameter.name: CenterFrequencySegment1
parameter.description: When operating in {{enum|80+80MHz|CurrentOperatingChannelBandwidth}}, this parameter determines the Center Frequency Segment 1 for the second 80 MHz channel. See {{bibref|802.11-2016|Section 9.4.2.161}} and Table 9-252.

parameter.name: MCS
parameter.description: The Modulation Coding Scheme index (applicable to 802.11n, 802.11ac, and 802.11ax specifications only). Values from 0 to 15 MUST be supported for ({{bibref|802.11n-2009}}). Values from 0 to 9 MUST be supported for {{bibref|802.11ac-2013}}. Values from 0 to 11 MUST be supported for {{bibref|802.11ax}}. A value of -1 indicates automatic selection of the MCS index.

parameter.name: TransmitPowerSupported
parameter.description:
{{list}} List items represent supported transmit power levels as {{units}} of full power. For example, "0,25,50,75,100".
A -1 item indicates auto mode (automatic decision by CPE). Auto mode allows the ''Radio'' to adjust transmit power accordingly. For example, this can be useful for power-save modes such as EU-CoC, where the ''Radio'' can adjust power according to activity in the CPE.

parameter.name: TransmitPower
parameter.description: Indicates the current transmit power level as a {{units}} of full power. The value MUST be one of the values reported by the {{param|TransmitPowerSupported}} parameter. A value of -1 indicates auto mode (automatic decision by CPE).

parameter.name: IEEE80211hSupported
parameter.description: Indicates whether IEEE 802.11h {{bibref|802.11h-2003}} functionality is supported by this radio. The value can be {{true}} only if the 802.11a or the 802.11n@5GHz standard is supported (i.e. {{param|SupportedFrequencyBands}} includes {{enum|5GHz|SupportedFrequencyBands}} and {{param|SupportedStandards}} includes {{enum|a|SupportedStandards}} and/or {{enum|n|SupportedStandards}}).

parameter.name: IEEE80211hEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether IEEE 802.11h functionality is enabled on this radio. The value can be {{true}} only if the 802.11a or the 802.11n@5GHz standard is supported and enabled (i.e. {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is {{enum|5GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}} and {{param|OperatingStandards}} includes {{enum|a|OperatingStandards}} and/or {{enum|n|OperatingStandards}}).

parameter.name: RegulatoryDomain
parameter.description: The 802.11d Regulatory Domain. First two octets are {{bibref|ISO3166-1}} two-character country code. The third octet is either " " (all environments), "O" (outside) or "I" (inside).

parameter.name: RetryLimit
parameter.description: The maximum number of retransmissions of a short packet i.e. a packet that is no longer than the {{param|RTSThreshold}}. This corresponds to IEEE 802.11 parameter ''dot11ShortRetryLimit'' {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: CCARequest
parameter.description: A request for the clear channel assessment (CCA) report in the format specified in {{bibref|802.11-2012|Clause 8.4.2.23.3}}.

parameter.name: CCAReport
parameter.description:
The clear channel assessment (CCA) report in the format specified in {{bibref|802.11-2012|Clause 8.4.2.24.3}}.
When read, the value of this parameter MUST correspond to {{param|CCARequest}}. How this is achieved is a local matter to the CPE.
If this parameter is read before a CCARequest has been issued, then its value is {{empty}}.

parameter.name: RPIHistogramRequest
parameter.description: A request for a received power indicator (RPI) histogram in the format specified in {{bibref|802.11-2012|Clause 8.4.2.23.4}}.

parameter.name: RPIHistogramReport
parameter.description: Received power indicator (RPI) histogram report in the format specified in {{bibref|802.11-2012|Clause 8.4.2.24.4}}.

parameter.name: FragmentationThreshold
parameter.description: This specifies the current maximum size, in {{units}}, of the MPDU that can be delivered to the PHY. This parameter is based on ''dot11FragmentationThreshold'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: RTSThreshold
parameter.description: This indicates the number of {{units}} in an MPDU, below which an RTS/CTS handshake is not performed. This parameter is based on ''dot11RTSThreshold'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: LongRetryLimit
parameter.description: This indicates the maximum number of transmission attempts of a frame, the length of which is greater than {{param|RTSThreshold}}, that will be made before a failure condition is indicated. This parameter is based on ''dot11LongRetryLimit'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: BeaconPeriod
parameter.description: Time interval between transmitting beacons (expressed in {{units}}). This parameter is based on ''dot11BeaconPeriod'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: DTIMPeriod
parameter.description: This specifies the number of beacon intervals that elapse between transmission of Beacon frames containing a TIM element whose DTIM Count field is 0. This parameter is based on ''dot11DTIMPeriod'' from {{bibref|802.11-2020}}.

parameter.name: PacketAggregationEnable
parameter.description: This determines whether or not packet aggregation (commonly called "frame aggregation") is enabled. This applies only to 802.11n.

parameter.name: PreambleType
